title: CONTRIBUTING

README contain badges continuous integration services used package. recommend tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals in R
text: Symbiota open-source content management system built purpose integrating virtual biodiversity databases. Currently used 700 natural history collections, containing 30 million specimens, Symbiota essential tool digitizing biological specimen data. effort expand modularity accessibility, Symbiota2 improved, refactored version original Symbiota core code structure, designed based user feedback. packages exist accessing Symbiota portals (instance, see rSymbiota package), R users currently access data offered Symbiota2. , describe SymbiotaR2, package built address need allowing users access Symbiota2 portals R environment. , provide general workflow using SymbiotaR2, description command structure, code installing package, examples using SymbiotaR2 functions. GitHub page Symbiota2 software can found , instructions setting new Symbiota2 portal can found documentation site. Finally, review original Symbiota platform offered Gries et al., 2014.

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals in R
text: SymbiotaR2 allows R users download data specified Symbiota2 portals, granting access thousands digitized flora fauna specimen records across United States. querying endpoints Symbiota2 API, downloading JSON object containing requested data temporary directory local computer. JSON object converted R format straightforward easy use. general argument structure SymbiotaR2 functions allows users specify whether want pull single resource collection resources API. general, four steps using SymbiotaR2: Determine URL Symbiota2 portal wish access data ; “API endpoint” probably web address “api” appended (see ). Remember particular portal may enabled data download. Load SymbiotaR2 package (see Installation install instructions). Functions named resources download, grouped according relevant API call. Note , Symbiota2 portal owner can load plugins API, ’s possible every API endpoint covered. can find full list typing library(help=SymbiotaR2) Call function, specifying Symbiota2 portal using url argument (see Example Portal Specification ).

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals in R
text: SymbiotaR2 can downloaded calling: passed peer review, able install running: Load package using:
code: library(devtools) install_github("pearselab/SymbiotaR2") install.packages("SymbiotaR2") library(SymbiotaR2)

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals in R
text: SymbiotaR2_setup save .Rprofile default URL, automatic reference. Specifying different url argument let refer portal besides default. code demonstrates :
code: SymbiotaR2_setup("http://imaginary-symbiota-portal.com/api", append=TRUE)  Coordinates() # Download from http://imaginary-symbiota-portal.com/api Coordinates("http://another-imaginary-portal.com/api") # Download from a different portal

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals in R
text: SymbiotaR2 consists commands pulling Checklists, Collections, Crowdsource, Exsiccati, Glossary, ImageProcessor, Key, Media, Occurrence, Reference, Taxa, Traits, UserRoles API families specified Symbiota2 portal. Note Symbiota2 portal owner can load plugins API, ’s possible every possible API endpoint specified Symbiota2 instance covered. , provide example pulling single Taxa resource R environment, specifying id argument command call (using random, nonexistent URL). Please note example won’t work users (need specify working Symbiota2 portal can access), included demonstrate typical usage: collection resources Symbiota2 API needs come R environment, page argument can specified place id retrieve list resources (, data.frame): neither id page argument provided, functions written return list resources page = 1. downloaded, R objects can taken manipulated needed downstream processes.
code: myURL <- "http://imaginary-symbiota2-portal.com/api" myTaxa <- Taxa(id = 12, url = myURL) str(myTaxa) List of 23  $ @context             : chr "/api/contexts/Taxa"  $ @id                  : chr "/api/taxa/12"  $ @type                : chr "Taxa"  $ id                   : num 12  $ rankId               : chr "/api/taxa/ranks/31"  $ scientificName       : chr "Polygonum bistortoides"  $ unitIndicator1       : logi NA  $ unitName1            : chr "Polygonum"  $ unitIndicator2       : logi NA  $ unitName2            : chr "bistortoides"  $ unitIndicator3       : logi NA  $ unitName3            : logi NA  $ author               : chr "Pursh"  $ phylogenySortSequence: logi NA  $ status               : chr "AZTT-USDA Plants consistant"  $ source               : logi NA  $ notes                : logi NA  $ hybrid               : logi NA  $ securityStatus       : num 0  $ modifiedTimestamp    : logi NA  $ initialTimestamp     : chr "2019-01-11T21:44:39+00:00"  $ modifiedUserId       : logi NA  $ taxaAuthorityId      : list() myURL <- "http://imaginary-symbiota2-portal.com/api" myCoordinates <- Coordinates(page = 1, url = myURL) str(my.Coordinates) 'data.frame':   5 obs. of  2 variables:  $ latitude : num  32.2 32.2 32.2 32.2 32.2  $ longitude: num  -111 -111 -111 -111 -111

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals in R
text: code SymbiotaR2 structured hierarchically, includes parameter type checking ensure arguments provided proper format. Additionally, commands include URL check (.check.url), confirms following: URL provided refers accessible website, website working Symbiota2 portal. second step consists API call made end URL check. either step fails, error triggered: error received, make sure portal address spelled correctly. Note functions designed forward slash (/) end URL optional. URL correctly spelled, make sure Symbiota2 portal manager allowed access portal.
code: Error in .check.url(badURL) :    URL http://incorrect-portal-address.com/api cannot be reached; is it a valid Symbiota2 portal API?

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals in R
text: SymbiotaR2 functions come tests, pulling single SymbiotaR2 resource (using id argument), collection resources (using page). Tests function contained tests/testthat directory. Running tests requires access fully configured SymbiotaR2 test instance, complete demo data, time-consuming setup time/bandwidth-consuming run tests. therefore release cached data downloads, generated using vcr, use package. Information vcr package can found vcr page GitHub. run package tests, following: Build package normally, something like R CMD    build SymbiotaR2 command line. Check package normally, something like R CMD    check SymbbiotaR2_0.0-1 command line. want add new tests, new functions address new API endpoints, following: Setup Symbiota2 instance canned example data. adding support new API endpoint, make new file tests/testthat tests. Otherwise, add one existing files. Write test, following coding style tests, particularly respect setting vcr cassette. Note folder fixtures contains cassettes, SymbiotaR2 makes use file tests/testthat/helper-SymbiotaR2.R setup automatic tests. See point 4 . writing/checking test, set url variable top script wherever test instance . committing code submit pull request (see point 5), change address top tests (currently http://a02235015-6.bluezone.usu.edu/api/). finished, submit pull request master branch repository. Please use pull request template follow contributor guidelines. example piece testing code may look like: data <- AccessStates(url = url, id = 4) line Symbiota2 call, test_that block contains test conditions–, data object list length 12.
code: context("AccessStats") vcr::use_cassette(name = "AccessStats_id", {   data <- AccessStats(id = 4, url = url) }) test_that("AccessStats_id", {   expect_equal(length(data), 12)   expect_type(data, "list") })

title: Downloading Data from Symbiota2 Portals into R
text: general, four steps using SymbiotaR2: Determine URL Symbiota2 portal wish access data ; “API endpoint” probably web address “api” appended (see ). Remember particular portal may enabled data download. Load SymbiotaR2 package (see Installation install instructions). Functions named resources download, grouped according relevant API call. Note , Symbiota2 portal owner can load plugins API, ’s possible every API endpoint covered. can find full list typing library(help=SymbiotaR2) Call function, specifying Symbiota2 portal using url argument (see Example Portal Specification ). R code provides example install Coordinates resource example Symbiota2 portal , myCoordinates object can used desired.
code: # Step 1 - Find the URL myURL <- "http://imaginary-symbiota2-portal.com/api" # Step 2 - Install the package (only required the first time you're using it) install.packages("SymbiotaR2")  # Step 3 - Load the package library(SymbiotaR2) # Step 4 - Choose the kind of data you want library(help=SymbiotaR2) # Step 5 - Download your data myCoordinates <- Coordinates(url = myURL)

title: Summary
text: SymbiotaR2 R [@R2018] package easily accessing handling specimen-based Symbiota2 data within R environment, allowing anyone download digitized biological collection data established database. Symbiota2 updated version Symbiota [@Symbiota2014], widely used software platform grants access data >750 museums herbaria worldwide. complete refactoring Symbiota code, structure Symbiota2 places emphasis modularity accessibility.

title: Summary
text: release SymbiotaR2 motivated ongoing development Symbiota2. Several R packages already exist accessing data standard Symbiota portals; Symbiota2 complete refactoring original framework, new package required interface new Symbiota2 portals. goal package allow users access digitized biological specimen data hosted via Symbiota2 portals quickly efficiently. data include geographic, taxonomic, genetic information tied recorded specimen, well pertinent collection information, images, publications. making data accessible R, SymbiotaR2 part broader Symbiota effort creating collaborative environment share biodiversity data widely.

title: Summary
text: code provides example user accessing two different attributes entry within Symbiota2 database. First, data particular entry (, id=28) pulled R using “Occurrences” API endpoint. , different attributes associated entry (reproductiveCondition, decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude) printed. specification url argument (beginning example) allows users reference web address corresponding Symbiota2 portal interest. , R objects manipulated used downstream analysis. library provides built commands default API endpoints included given Symbiota2 portal. endpoints include access several different resources: trait data, taxonomic classification, collector information, much .
code: # Specify web address from which to access Symbiota2 API > url <- "http://demo.portal.address/api/"  # Pull occurrence information associated with database entry (id=28) > test.Occ <- Occurrences(id=28, url=url)  # Find reproductive condition for entry of interest > print(test.Occ$reproductiveCondition) [1]   "bud" # Retrieve and concatenate coordinates for entry of interest > test.coord <- c(test.Occ$decimalLatitude, test.Occ$decimalLongitude) > print(test.coord) [1]   50.70 -103.65

what: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals into R — SymbiotaR2
title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals into R — SymbiotaR2
text: package allows users access  download Symbiota2, content management system  biodiveristy data.

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals into R — SymbiotaR2
text: Symbiota2 improved, refactored version Symbiota,  open source content management system biological specimen data. SymbiotaR2 allows users access data available Symbiota2 portals. specifying URL  relevant portal, resource downloaded, users can use SymbiotaR2 deliver biological specimen-data  R format.

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals into R — SymbiotaR2
text: Package functions organized API family, generally group functions type resource pull portal. function can either return individual resources (specifying `id` argument) collection resources (specifying `page` argument). providing either `id`  `page` resources, URL relevant portal,  SymbiotaR2 return R object (`id`, usually list; `page`, usually data.frame).

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals into R — SymbiotaR2
text: SymbiotaR2 commands require URL directs Symiobta2 portal download data . Users need make sure granted access Symbiota2 portal trying download data . address Symbiota2 portal provided `url` string  argument function. specify default URL, use  `SymbiotaR2_setup` function, default url .Rprofile. package allows users access data existing Symbiota2 portals; create new Symbiota2 portal, see documentation https://symbiota2.github.io/Symbiota2/setup/installation.html

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals into R — SymbiotaR2
text: https://symbiota.org/docs/ Gries, C., Gilbert, E. E., & Franz, N. M. (2014). Symbiota - virtual platform creating voucher-based biodiversity information communities. Biodiversity Data Journal, 2, e1114.

title: Downloading data from Symbiota2 portals into R — SymbiotaR2
code: if (FALSE) { myURL <- "http://ImaginarySymbiota2Portal.com/api" myTaxa <- Taxa(id = 12, url = myURL) str(myTaxa)  myOccurrences <- Occurrence(page = 2, url = myURL) length(myOccurrences) }

what: Set default URL for Symbiota2 portal download — SymbiotaR2_setup
title: Set default URL for Symbiota2 portal download — SymbiotaR2_setup
text: Sets SymbiotaR2_url option , optionally, appending .Rprofile. Checks whether specified valid URL can reached, attempts pull  resource API, confirm URL specify  Symbiota2 portal.

title: Set default URL for Symbiota2 portal download — SymbiotaR2_setup
code: SymbiotaR2_setup(url, append = FALSE, verbose = TRUE)

title: Set default URL for Symbiota2 portal download — SymbiotaR2_setup
text: url URL Symbiota2 portal (trailing / appended, given) append logical whether attempt append .Rprofile file, making default every time start R verbose logical whether display output

title: Set default URL for Symbiota2 portal download — SymbiotaR2_setup
text: Invisbly, URL stored

title: Set default URL for Symbiota2 portal download — SymbiotaR2_setup
text: Pearse

title: Set default URL for Symbiota2 portal download — SymbiotaR2_setup
code: if (FALSE) { # An example (that doesn't work because it's not a real portal) SymbiotaR2_setup("http://nonexistent-portal.com/api/") # Trying to save a non-existence portal SymbiotaR2_setup("http://nonexistent-portal.com/api/", TRUE) }
